references.paper_title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), a fundamental model for graph neural networks, which is extensively used and analyzed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Inductive Representation Learning on Large Graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces GraphSAGE, another important GNN model used in this paper's experiments for its ability to handle inductive learning tasks on large graphs.
This paper, also authored by one of this paper's authors, provides foundational work on the challenges of GNNs in heterophilic settings, directly relevant to this paper's focus.

references.paper_title: Graph neural networks for link prediction with subgraph sketching
references.reason: This paper introduces a state-of-the-art link prediction method (BUDDY) which this paper uses as a comparison and analyzes to understand its behavior in heterophilic settings.

references.paper_title: Link prediction based on graph neural networks
references.reason: This is one of the earliest works applying graph neural networks to link prediction, providing a baseline for this paper's investigation into improving GNN performance for this task.
